name: Tale of which of 3 druids to build. Which 1 build? Help plz
author: Asturonethoriusaline

posts.author: Asturonethoriusaline
posts.content:
Had problems with my tablet, smart phone and NWN.

But now I got my Smartphone and NWN working, plus can get it for my Xbox.

So decided to build 1 of 3 druid builds.

I need help deciding which one to build, and need help with the build.

In no particular order.

A. Ranger/Druid/Assassin.

Thinking of about Ranger 5/Druid 18/Assassin 17.

Would like to get 18 levels of Assassin but just not enough levels. I need 18 levels of Druid to take dragon form at 30th to 33rd levels, dont need more then 5 ranger levels to qualify for Assassin. 6th lev Ranger is meaningless because 6th level ranger gets a redundant animal companion that Druid gets at level 1.

Could go Ranger 4/Druid 18/Assassin 18, and just use 1,2,3 levels of druid to cross class points into hide, move silently, to qualify for Assassin.

B.Dragon Man Druid:

Bard 4/6/Druid 18/RDD 16/18

The idea is to use Bard to qualify for RDD, and lev 2 Bard buff spells to go with Druid buffs to make character that has half dragon like abilities that can be used with all druidic forms, and will give each form better AC, Strength.

The build will reach its conclusion when it can not only turn into a dragon at 30th to 33rd level but then use RDD, Bard, Druid Spells to buff the dragon up more with higher AC, Str, Breath Weapon, etc.

C. Cleric/Druid/Shifter

Str Domain, Magic Domain Cleric 5th level(Divine Power at 3rd level spells, due to str domain/Druid 17/18/Shifter 17/18

The idea is to use Divine Power, Divine Favor, and the Cleric Magic Domain, and druid buffs to buff the heck out of the druid shifter, animal companion forms, and dragon form when get to 30th to 33rd level.

So which of these 3 druid builds should I build, and please help me build these builds with advice, what I should do at each level, etc.

I am not asking to build it all for me. But the help will, would help me to then customize, tweak build help to make it my build.

In doing so i would probably accept, use, do, etc, some to most to almost almost all help.

But that said I might disagree, and not use a little help.

But whether I use given help or not.

I am listening, carefully considering, thinking about, etc, all help given.

So I appreciate any, all help given.

I say this so that no one gets offended, feels like their advice is wasted, not appreciated, listened to, etc.

Thanks for the help, and all the help that has been given in past.

Asturonethoriusaline

Mike

posts.author: MentalDekay
posts.content:
As others would say, a lot of the answer will be dependent on where you're playing.

All of your first pass level breakdowns will be vulnerable to buff disspelling. 

I've liked and toyed with the Bard/Druid/RDD some because the concept feels very appropriate. But I haven't pushed it to high levels in an actual campaign. Much of the RDD goodies are made moot tho by Dragon Shape.

Druid/Assassin sounds interesting, if you don't mind being evil. I'm not very well versed in assassin as I really only started toying with it when Beamdog nerfed the Death Attack.

Shifter sounds fun, but you might be spreading yourself thin if your real intention is Dragon Shape. Plus, from all I've seen, most people identify a particular shape to focus on (undead, rashaka, kobold) and then compliment the other factors in the build to strengthen it.

posts.author: Asturonethoriusaline
posts.content:
MentalDekay wrote: ↑
Aug 10, 2020
As others would say, a lot of the answer will be dependent on where you're playing.

All of your first pass level breakdowns will be vulnerable to buff disspelling. 

I've liked and toyed with the Bard/Druid/RDD some because the concept feels very appropriate. But I haven't pushed it to high levels in an actual campaign. Much of the RDD goodies are made moot tho by Dragon Shape.

Druid/Assassin sounds interesting, if you don't mind being evil. I'm not very well versed in assassin as I really only started toying with it when Beamdog nerfed the Death Attack.

Shifter sounds fun, but you might be spreading yourself thin if your real intention is Dragon Shape. Plus, from all I've seen, most people identify a particular shape to focus on (undead, rashaka, kobold) and then compliment the other factors in the build to strengthen it.
Thanks for your response.

PW: Blackstone Keep, or a Mod like Eye of the Beholder, Diablo. Non PW, offline solo, single player Raines WOG, Aielund, etc.

Yeah Assassin is semi nerfed, but can still paralyze with it, and it still works great.

Picture this. Sneak up to target in 1 of the better forms, paralyze target, either let your animals kill it, or kill it yourself. If in a group. Paralyze it, kill it, let animals engage others, while you temp run away enough distance to hide, come back, paralyze kill another, rinse, repeat.

For Dragon Shape, you need: 18th level+ Druid: Druid has to have Wild Shape 6, which get at Druid 18, or greater wild shape 4, which get at Shifter 10.

You have to be 21+ epic to take Dragon Shape, and soonest that can take Dragon Shape is about 27,28,29,30 depending on build.

And these 3 builds would take it about levels 30 to 33.

As to dispelling buffs. Yes cleric, bard buffs will get dispelled somewhere between epic 20th to 40th level.

But until then those buffs combined with Druid Buffs(not dispellable until about 35th to 37th level+, because 18 druid levels), turn a transformed Druid into a freak.

Also not everything dispells, altho a lot of bad guy spellcasters do dispell.

As to Druid/Shifter Splits: Druid 18 to 20/Shifter 16 to 18 is optimal for taking Dragon Shape about level 29, 30.

I know that from making a Monk 6/Druid 18 to 20/Shifter 16 to 18

If dont focus on dragon shape, then can go with Epic Shifter until u get your first bonus feat for epic shifter, at about 13th,14th level, and use the extra 2,3,4,5,6 levels and tack them onto Druid levels for about a level 20 to level 24 druid.

But that means not taking dragon shape until 33rd to 36th level.

A level 24 druid wont have its spell buffs dispelled until 40th level tho.

And as far as the cleric, Bard buffs getting dispelled at levels 18+, your only taking the 6 bard levels to qualify for RDD, Bard Song, Level 2,3 buff spells.

Cleric gives you not only the buffs, but lets you walk around in better armor, when not transformed, and expands what weapons can use.

The Ranger/Druid/Assassin has to be at Ranger 4/Druid 18/Assassin 18 because:

Need minimum 4 ranger levels to help qualify for Assassin.

Need a absolute minimum of 18 levels of Assassin. You get 2 bonus feats at Epic Assassin level 18. And anything less then 18, and your DC will be crap. I know thst at level 18, your DC is not as good as it should be according to Mik Dagger Assassin King, and he is right, but 18 is as high as can get in this build, and whatever the Assassin is not able to do, the character can easily find another way.

The Druid has to be at least 18 levels, and would be level 20/20 split between Druid/Assassin, if could use Druid to qualify for Assassin, instead of 4 levels of Ranger.

Thats about it. Hope that helps you, others help, give advice, participate, etc.

Thanks.

Mike

posts.author: Asturonethoriusaline
posts.content:
Also I just thought of scrapping the shifter levels of the cleric/druid\Shifter build.

That would put the build at Cleric 16/Druid 24. The Cleric Buffs would be harder to dispel, and would get Harm, Blade Barrier.

What would be the optimal split between Cleric/Druid? Is Cleric 16/Druid 24 good like it seems.

Also strength build or Dex build?

I think that if went with

Strength 10

Dex 18

Con 10

Int 14

Wis 16

Cha 8

That should be able to get wisdom to 19,20 for 8th level cleric spells, and 9th level druid spells.

And should be able to get about a 24 to 26 to 28 dex in non transformed, and almost irrelevant while transformed.

The only prob with a dex build is not being able to use the better Armor that a cleric gives you.

But the prob with strength is that strength is just going to be replaced by transformation, and buffs anyways.

So maybe

Strength 10/12/14(for +1, +2 to hit while not transformed

Dex 13/14/16(For Expertise etc, and for ranged/Med Armor

Con 12/14/16

Int 14/16

Wis 15/16/17

Cha 8/10/12

So what would be the optimal stats here if dont go dex build??

posts.author: Asturonethoriusaline
posts.content:
Also how long would it take, how many levels would it take for a druid to cross class skill into Assassin?

Just wondering if can not have to take 4 Ranger levels to get Assassin???

posts.author: Asturonethoriusaline
posts.content:
Also whats the optimal split for Bard/Druid/RDD???

I would think Bard 5,6/Druid 18 to 20 to 22/RDD 14 to 16 to 18 would be good.

But maybe there is better.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
To be Assassin, you need
Alignment: any evil

Skills: hide 8 ranks, move silently 8 ranks
As Druid does not have Hide or Move Silently as Class Skills, that means they have to take them as cross-class.
The highest the ranks in a cross-class skill can be raised to is (character level + 3)/2
Druid level 13 will be required (Druid 13 + 3 = 16/2 = 8).

posts.author: Asturonethoriusaline
posts.content:
webshaman1 wrote: ↑
Aug 10, 2020
To be Assassin, you need
Alignment: any evil

Skills: hide 8 ranks, move silently 8 ranks
As Druid does not have Hide or Move Silently as Class Skills, that means they have to take them as cross-class.
The highest the ranks in a cross-class skill can be raised to is (character level + 3)/2
Druid level 13 will be required (Druid 13 + 3 = 16/2 = 8).
So question, do you think its ok, good to wait 13 druid levels, to prestige to Assassin, instead of taking 4 Ranger levels to help qualify for Assassin??

My thoughts are that it would take too long, be to long of a wait, because Pre Epic of Druid 13/Assassin 7, would not do good enough Assassin DC wise.

And Druid 13/Assassin 1 would likely have its level 1 DC resisted at 14th level.

At least that's what it seems like to me.

But maybe my thinking on that is wrong.

Hence why I am asking what you think.

Also would be nice for Mik Dagger to chime in on this.

Thanks

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
A single level of ranger or any other class the has stealth as class skills can help get assassin earlier. But you already know that.
There is not a great amount of synergy between druid and assassin. That becomes clear when you want both dragon shape and a high DA DC.
If it is a sneak attacking dragon you want, both rogue and assassin will work. Rogue is easier to build with and can also work together with monk without alignment changes. Assassin on the other hand can help against xp penalties.

Max has made this build: Surprise! **Death** (Camouflaged Dragon) - Druid 24 / Assassin 14 / Shadowdancer 2

A quick search through the old archives brought up the following druid/ assassin builds...

Forest Shadow druid 30 / assassin 9 / monk 1 (elf?) by kevinxiaowis
Divine Exclamation druid 37 / assassin 2 / monk 1 (human?) by Thaxll'ssyllia
Forest Imp druid 7 / monk 3 / assassin 30 (halfling) by DarkInfernoo
Thaxll'ssyllia V2 monk 1 / druid 14 / assassin 25 (human) by Thaxll'ssyllia
Shadow Master ranger 21 / druid 10 / assassin 9 (human) by Anuis
Nature's Dark Avenger druid 5 / shifter 17 / assassin 18 (human) by Amazon Queen
Poisonous Paralyte druid 5 / shifter 17 / assassin 18 (human?) by WhiZard
Shaper of Death druid 5 / shifter 19 / assassin 16 (elf) by Emrill
Black Adder druid 6 / shifter 7 / assassin 27 (elf) by Bromium
Death says Yip! druid 7 / shifter 7 / assassin 26 (dwarf) by koolthursday

...and the following druid Rogue builds:

Shay druid 7 / rogue 13 / blackguard 20 (human) by Blake Whelm
Claw 'Em When They're Down rogue 16 / druid 14 / champion of Torm 10 (halfling) by Ariel Thomas
Dragon Slinger v2.0 rogue 10 / cleric 15 / druid 15 (human) by CrispyCritter
Lonely Wacko fighter 18 / rogue 19 / druid 3 (halfling) by Kalmar_Oxin
Shadowy Dragon druid 14 / monk 1 / rogue 25 (halfling?) by Dennis05
The Equalizer druid 15 / monk 6 / rogue 19 (human) by jonyb2
(Druid 20/Monk 12/Rogue 8) druid 20 / monk 12 / rogue 8 (elf?) by SharpDog
The Perfect Combatant druid 26 / monk 1 / rogue 13 (human) by Calbrenar
Nimble Dragon druid 30 / monk 9 / rogue 1 (dwarf) by Chiibo
The Shadow's Breath druid 20 / rogue 13 / monk 7 (human) by Nimueh_Leafbow
Dragon Slinger rogue 13 / druid 20 / monk 7 (human) by CrispyCritter
Witch druid 37 / rogue 1 / shadowdancer 2 (human) by Aligory
Strength Smotherer druid 5 / shifter 16 / rogue 19 (human?) by WhiZard
The Scamp druid 6 / shifter 17 / rogue 17 (human) by ZelleQyllvan
The Grifter rogue 19 / druid 5 / shifter 16 (halfling) by ragnaroque

Take a look at them and see what has been done with the classes earlier!

I see that there are Monk/Druid/Assassin's. Arent those not doable without special Mod/PW/DM/Admin/permision/Alignment changes, because have to have Neutral Evil Align for a Druid/Assassin, and Monk cant have NE???

I also have thought of a Monk 1/Druid 24/Rogue 15 or Monk 6/Druid 24/Rogue 10 or a Monk 6/Druid 22/Rogue 12.

If I did it with the Ranger then Ranger 1/Druid 20/Assassin 19 or Ranger 1/Druid 19/Assassin 20, or Ranger 1/Druid 21/Assassin 18, or Ranger 1/Druid 22/Assassin 17

If I use Max's build I would tweak it to:

Druid 22/Assassin 16/SD 2.

What do you think, and which of these options, splits, etc, so you think I should do???

posts.author: Asturonethoriusaline
posts.content:
Ok after thinking long and hard about this.

I have decided to do either a Human Monk 6/Druid 21/Rogue 13, or a Human Monk 1/Druid 25/26/Rogue 13/14

The Monk 6/Druid 21/Rog 13, gives me both Improved Trip, and Epic Dodge, but is even tho tough to dispel at lev 21, still dispellable.

The Monk 1/Druid 25/26/Rogue 13/14, is both not dispellable, and has epic dodge, but doesnt have Improved Trip at Monk 6, and even with Human extra feat, hard, almost impossible to get Improved Trip AND the rest of the feats that need.

I think that Monk 6/Druid 21/Rogue 13 might be the way to go, but I'm not sure.

Now that I have selected a druid build, what do you guys think is opt level splits for both pre epic and epic.

Thanks for the help and any more help with this build is appreciated thanks.
